A property in a serverdef with a default value file containing eclipse variables like ${workspace_loc} cause the following exception (the same is caused when undeclared variables are used). 

java.lang.StackOverflowError
	at java.util.HashMap.hash(HashMap.java:264)
	at java.util.HashMap.get(HashMap.java:320)
	at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.internal.xml.Resolver.resolveProperty(Resolver.java:127)

Entering an eclipse variable like ${workspace_loc} seems to work, but not if it's used as default value like this:

<property id="keyStore" label="JMS key store:" type="string" context="server" default="${workspace_loc}/my_project/etc/certs/myapp.p12"/>

I thinks it would be very useful if one could use eclipse variables in default values.

eclipse variables are not supported in serverdef files, and I must admit java.lang.StackOverflowError
is not a good error. I am working to fix that.

I am using this as an enhancement request for use of eclipse variables.
